You might have more luck asking at [http://groups.msn.com/MicrosoftVOLTuserscommunity/messageboard.msnw](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016230006/http:/groups.msn.com/MicrosoftVOLTuserscommunity/messageboard.msnw "http://groups.msn.com/MicrosoftVOLTuserscommunity/messageboard.msnw")

I have no idea how to search past threads. Perhaps [Si](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016230006/http:/www.typophile.com/user/1049) can share some hints on how to take advantage of [Live Search](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016230006/http:/www.live.com/).

There is no need to duplicate lookups, just drag same lookups into your feature, the same way you would associate lookup with feautres in different scripts or language systems:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016230006im_/http:/typophile.com/files/features_3500.JPG)

OpenType layout does not allow to references between features. Your example is only AFDK syntax to include all lookups from one feature to another.

Thanks,  
Sergey
